availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Indiana Union artillery unit. Organized and initially on duty in Indianapolis, Indiana as guards for Confederate prisoners until transferred to Louisville, Kentucky on July 4, 1863. Served as an artillery attachment in the District of Louisville from July 4, 1863 to September 1863. Served in campaigns in Kentucky, North Carolina, and Tennessee until the surrender of Johnson's army. Unit was mustered out on July 2, 1865.

ab.bibl: Soldiers and Sailors Database"Battle Unit Details," "Union Indiana Volunteers, 23rd Battery, Indiana Light Artillery," https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-battle-units-detail.htm?battleUnitCode=UIN0023YAL, accessed May 13, 2020.
